12.content:
You had lived a relatively happy life in your tribe, guarded from the giants. However, you knew from an early age that the giants only let your kind survive because they had various “uses” for you, and at your height (about 1/2 of their inches) a single giant could easily destroy an entire tribe of tinies on their own if they were willing. Your tribe was replenished with new tinies every so often, whether found by benevolent giants (a tiny that’s been accidentally squished is of no use to anyone) or born to a giant.

Every once in awhile, there would be a “harvest” of tinies who had reached adulthood. You had managed to avoid most of the harvests, but now it was your turn, as the elders of your tribe escorted you and a group of other tinies to the massive box in the middle of the town square. A giant woman was on hand to collect the box. As you jostled around you wondered what would happen next. You heard stories and rumors, but the only thing you knew for sure was that it wouldn’t be pleasant.

You were taken to pet store to live in a plastic hamster cage with about 25 other tinies. Most seemed to be in their twenties, but some were older or younger than that. The people minding the cages left massive giant-sized meals for the entire group to eat. Over the next few days you saw various girls and women reach into your cage and grab tinies. From what you heard some would be used as pets or toys by children, others used as “toys” or slaves by women, and a lot were just eaten as snacks. You dreaded to think about your life after you were taken.

A little girl with shoulder length blonde hair of about 6 years of age stopped to fawn over the cage full of cute tinies. She tugged her mom’s hand and pointed at the cage, begging her mom to get one until she reluctantly gave in. There was something different about her, she seemed more gentle than the rest. Maybe this could be your chance?

121.content:
You decided to try to be taken by the girl now, or else you would probably end up being taken away by someone worse.

The girl reached into the cage, and you stepped forward as everyone else scattered. (Did they know something you didn’t?) She gently dropped you into a small paper box with holes for breathing along the top.

In the car, you heard the girl talking to her mom.

“I wanted more cute lil tinies, mommy,” the girl cooed.

“You remember what happened last time, Kayla, when you brought home those five tinies? And the ones before that? Or the other ones I got you for your birthday, what happened to those? And then there were the ones you let Jennifer borrow—”

“Sorry mommy I just got carried away, it won’t happen again I promise,” Kayla protested.

“Well maybe if you’re careful with this one I’ll get you more. These things are expensive for just toys, you know,” the mom explained. “And they’re so fragile.”

You gulped. Now you weren’t so sure about your prospects. Would you just be another pet killed by this little girl? “Got carried away”, what did that even mean?

You spotted a hole with faint light pouring through at the bottom of the box. You could probably dig through the flimsy paper of the box and escape when the right moment came along. But do you want to take that risk?
121.title: Might as well take a chance

132.content:
Every month it's the same. Try to build up a community, struggle endlessly to find food an supplies, and then migrate to a new house before the big people grow suspicious of your existance. It wasn't an easy life, but it's life none the less.

Today was the beginning of another cycle, you and your people had finally found a new house to inhabit. And you knew nothing about the big person who owned it. But either way, it was time to see whatever supplies you could scrape together.
Joined by your usual crew of 5 men in their mid 20s.

It was still early in the morning when your group decided to venture into the unknown. Hoping that whoever owned this place was still sound asleep. At the first glance, you had hit the jackpot. As the floor was covered with leftover meals, clothings and other things which you could salvage.
Your entire group cheered and thanked whatever deity they knew of as they scattered towards multiple directions.
You however, decided to scale the couch in the center of the room for a better vantage point. As you darted toward it, your tribesmen had already found their hands full of supplies and were returning back to deposit it at their village.

"Holy shit, this smells like ass!" You exclaimed as you finally reached the top, poking your head above the edge as you saw the very overused couch cushions.
